info.title: Dynamic API Specification
info.description: This is a dynamically generated API specification for all endpoints existing on the current project.

get.description: Image typed files can be dynamically resized and transformed to fit any need.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset size configured in settings.

parameters.name: transforms
parameters.description: A JSON array of image transformations

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Download the asset to your computer

email.description: Email address of the user you're retrieving the access token for.

mode.description: Whether to retrieve the refresh token in the JSON response, or in a httpOnly cookie.

otp.description: The user's one-time-password (if MFA is enabled).

refresh_token.description: JWT access token you want to refresh. This token can't be expired.

mode.description: Whether to submit and retrieve the refresh token in the JSON response, or in a httpOnly cookie.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to invalidate. If you have the refresh token in a cookie through /auth/login, you don't have to submit it here.

mode.description: Whether the refresh token is submitted in the JSON response, or in a httpOnly cookie.

post.description: Request a reset password email to be send.

email.description: Email address of the user you're requesting a reset for.

post.description: The request a password reset endpoint sends an email with a link to the admin app which in turn uses this endpoint to allow the user to reset their password.

token.description: One-time use JWT token that is used to verify the user.

get.description: List configured OAuth providers.
Start OAuth flow using the specified provider

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Key of the activated OAuth provider.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Where to redirect on successful login.
If set the authentication details are set inside cookies otherwise a JSON is returned.

get.description: Retrieve the current schema. This endpoint is only available to admin users.

post.description: Update the instance's schema by passing the diff previously retrieved via `/schema/diff` endpoint in the JSON request body or a JSON/YAML file. This endpoint is only available to admin users.
Compare the current instance's schema against the schema snapshot in JSON request body or a JSON/YAML file and retrieve the difference. This endpoint is only available to admin users.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Bypass version and database vendor restrictions.

get.description: Perform a system status check and return the options.

parameters.description: The first time you create a project, the provided token will be saved and required for subsequent project installs. It can also be found and configured in `/config/__api.json` on your server.
parameters.name: super_admin_token

get.description: Ping, pong. Ping.. pong.

post.description: Generate a hash for a given string.
Generate a hash for a given string.

hash.description: Hash you want to verify against.

post.description: Re-sort items in collection based on start and to value of item

item.description: Primary key of item to move

to.description: Primary key of item where to move the current item to

post.description: Import multiple records from a JSON or CSV file into a collection.
Export a larger data set to a file in the File Library

format.description: What file format to save the export to. One of csv, xml, json

post.description: Resets both the data and schema cache of Directus.

get.description: Returns a random string of given length.
Returns a list of activity actions.
Retrieves the details of an existing activity action. Provide the primary key of the activity action and Directus will return the corresponding information.
List the files.

patch.description: Update multiple files at the same time.

get.description: Retrieve a single file by unique identifier.

patch.description: Update an existing file, and/or replace it's file contents.

title.description: Title for the file. Is extracted from the filename on upload, but can be edited by the user.

filename_download.description: Preferred filename when file is downloaded.

folder.description: Virtual folder where this file resides in.

tags.description: Tags for the file. Is automatically populated based on Exif data for images.

title.description: Title for the file. Is extracted from the filename on upload, but can be edited by the user.

filename_download.description: Preferred filename when file is downloaded.

folder.description: Virtual folder where this file resides in.

tags.description: Tags for the file. Is automatically populated based on Exif data for images.

get.description: Returns a list of the collections available in the project.

post.description: Create a new collection in Directus.

collection.description: Unique name of the collection.

fields.description: The fields contained in this collection. See the fields reference for more information. Each individual field requires field, type, and interface to be provided.

icon.description: Name of a Google Material Design Icon that's assigned to this collection.

display_template.description: Text representation of how items from this collection are shown across the system.

hidden.description: Whether or not the collection is hidden from the navigation in the admin app.

singleton.description: Whether or not the collection is treated as a single object.

translation.description: Key value pairs of how to show this collection's name in different languages in the admin app.

versioning.description: Whether or not Content Versioning is enabled for this collection.

archive_field.description: What field holds the archive value.

archive_app_filter.description: What value to use for "archived" items.

archive_value.description: What value to use to "unarchive" items.

unarchive_value.description: Whether or not to show the "archived" filter.

sort_field.description: The sort field in the collection.

get.description: Retrieves the details of a single collection.

icon.description: Name of a Google Material Design Icon that's assigned to this collection.

color.description: Choose the color for the icon assigned to this collection.

display_template.description: Text representation of how items from this collection are shown across the system.

hidden.description: Whether or not the collection is hidden from the navigation in the admin app.

singleton.description: Whether or not the collection is treated as a single object.

translation.description: Key value pairs of how to show this collection's name in different languages in the admin app.

versioning.description: Whether or not Content Versioning is enabled for this collection.

archive_field.description: What field holds the archive value.

archive_app_filter.description: What value to use for "archived" items.

archive_value.description: What value to use to "unarchive" items.

unarchive_value.description: Whether or not to show the "archived" filter.

sort_field.description: The sort field in the collection.

delete.description: Delete an existing collection. Warning: This will delete the whole collection, including the items within. Proceed with caution.

get.description: List the folders.

parent.description: Unique identifier of the parent folder. This allows for nested folders.

patch.description: Update multiple folders at the same time.

parent.description: Unique identifier of the parent folder. This allows for nested folders.

get.description: Retrieve a single folder by unique identifier.

name.description: Name of the folder. Can't be null or empty.

parent.description: Unique identifier of the parent folder. This allows for nested folders.

get.description: List the roles.

enforce_tfa.description: Whether or not this role enforces the use of 2FA.

external_id.description: ID used with external services in SCIM.

ip_access.description: Array of IP addresses that are allowed to connect to the API as a user of this role.

module_listing.description: Custom override for the admin app module bar navigation.

patch.description: Update multiple roles at the same time.

enforce_tfa.description: Whether or not this role enforces the use of 2FA.

external_id.description: ID used with external services in SCIM.

ip_access.description: Array of IP addresses that are allowed to connect to the API as a user of this role.

module_listing.description: Custom override for the admin app module bar navigation.

get.description: Retrieve a single role by unique identifier.

enforce_tfa.description: Whether or not this role enforces the use of 2FA.

external_id.description: ID used with external services in SCIM.

ip_access.description: Array of IP addresses that are allowed to connect to the API as a user of this role.

module_listing.description: Custom override for the admin app module bar navigation.

get.description: Returns a list of the fields available in the project.
Returns a list of the fields available in the given collection.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the collection the item resides in.
parameters.name: collection

post.description: Create a new field in a given collection.

field.description: Unique name of the field. Field name is unique within the collection.

type.description: Directus specific data type. Used to cast values in the API.

default_value.description: The default value of the field.

max_length.description: The max length of the field.

is_primary_key.description: If the field is primary key.

has_auto_increment.description: If the field has auto increment.

foreign_key_column.description: Related column from the foreign key constraint.

foreign_key_table.description: Related table from the foreign key constraint.

comment.description: Comment as saved in the database.

foreign_key_schema.description: Related schema from the foreign key constraint (pg only).

id.description: Unique identifier for the field in the `directus_fields` collection.

collection.description: Unique name of the collection this field is in.

field.description: Unique name of the field. Field name is unique within the collection.

system-interface.description: What interface is used in the admin app to edit the value for this field.

options.description: Options for the interface that's used. This format is based on the individual interface.

display.description: What display is used in the admin app to display the value for this field.

display_options.description: Options for the display that's used. This format is based on the individual display.

locked.description: If the field can be altered by the end user. Directus system fields have this value set to `true`.

readonly.description: Prevents the user from editing the value in the field.

hidden.description: If this field should be hidden.

sort.description: Sort order of this field on the edit page of the admin app.

width.description: Width of the field on the edit form.

group.description: What field group this field is part of.

translation.description: Key value pair of `<language>: <translation>` that allows the user to change the displayed name of the field in the admin app.

note.description: A user provided note for the field. Will be rendered alongside the interface on the edit page.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the collection the item resides in.
parameters.name: collection

parameters.name: collection

field.description: Unique name of the field. Field name is unique within the collection.

max_length.description: The max length of the field.

is_primary_key.description: If the field is primary key.

has_auto_increment.description: If the field has auto increment.

foreign_key_column.description: Related column from the foreign key constraint.

foreign_key_table.description: Related table from the foreign key constraint.

comment.description: Comment as saved in the database.

foreign_key_schema.description: Related schema from the foreign key constraint (pg only).

id.description: Unique identifier for the field in the `directus_fields` collection.

collection.description: Unique name of the collection this field is in.

field.description: Unique name of the field. Field name is unique within the collection.

system-interface.description: What interface is used in the admin app to edit the value for this field.

options.description: Options for the interface that's used. This format is based on the individual interface.

display.description: What display is used in the admin app to display the value for this field.

display_options.description: Options for the display that's used. This format is based on the individual display.

locked.description: If the field can be altered by the end user. Directus system fields have this value set to `true`.

readonly.description: Prevents the user from editing the value in the field.

hidden.description: If this field should be hidden.

sort.description: Sort order of this field on the edit page of the admin app.

width.description: Width of the field on the edit form.

group.description: What field group this field is part of.

translation.description: Key value pair of `<language>: <translation>` that allows the user to change the displayed name of the field in the admin app.

note.description: A user provided note for the field. Will be rendered alongside the interface on the edit page.

get.description: List the users.

patch.description: Update multiple users at the same time.

get.description: Retrieve a single user by unique identifier.

post.description: Invites one or more users to this project. It creates a user with an invited status, and then sends an email to the user with instructions on how to activate their account.

email.description: Email address or array of email addresses of the to-be-invited user(s).

post.description: Accepts and enables an invited user using a JWT invitation token.

get.description: Retrieve the currently authenticated user.

patch.description: Updates the last used page field of the currently authenticated user. This is used internally to be able to open the Directus admin app from the last page you used.

last_page.description: Path of the page you used last.

post.description: Enables two-factor authentication for the currently authenticated user.
Disables two-factor authentication for the currently authenticated user.

get.description: List the revisions.
Retrieve a single revision by unique identifier.
List all permissions.

collection.description: What collection this permission applies to.

comment.description: If the user can post comments.

create.description: If the user can create items.

delete.description: If the user can update items.

explain.description: If the user is required to leave a comment explaining what was changed.

read.description: If the user can read items.

role.description: Unique identifier of the role this permission applies to.

read_field_blacklist.description: Explicitly denies read access for specific fields.

status.description: What status this permission applies to.

status_blacklist.description: Explicitly denies specific statuses to be used.

update.description: If the user can update items.

write_field_blacklist.description: Explicitly denies write access for specific fields.

Retrieve a single permissions object by unique identifier.

collection.description: What collection this permission applies to.

comment.description: If the user can post comments. `full`.

create.description: If the user can create items.

delete.description: If the user can update items.

explain.description: If the user is required to leave a comment explaining what was changed.

read.description: If the user can read items.

role.description: Unique identifier of the role this permission applies to.

status.description: What status this permission applies to.

get.description: List the relations.

collection_many.description: Collection that has the field that holds the foreign key.

collection_one.description: Collection on the _one_ side of the relationship.

field_many.description: Foreign key. Field that holds the primary key of the related collection.

field_one.description: Alias column that serves as the _one_ side of the relationship.

junction_field.description: Field on the junction table that holds the primary key of the related collection.

get.description: Retrieve a single relation by unique identifier.

collection_many.description: Collection that has the field that holds the foreign key.

collection_one.description: Collection on the _one_ side of the relationship.

field_many.description: Foreign key. Field that holds the primary key of the related collection.

field_one.description: Alias column that serves as the _one_ side of the relationship.

junction_field.description: Field on the junction table that holds the primary key of the related collection.

get.description: List the presets.

collection.description: What collection this collection preset is used for.

title.description: Name for the bookmark. If this is set, the collection preset will be considered to be a bookmark.

role.description: The unique identifier of a role in the platform. If user is null, this will be used to apply the collection preset or bookmark for all users in the role.

search.description: What the user searched for in search/filter in the header bar.

layout.description: Name of the view type that is used.

layout_query.description: Layout query that's saved per layout type. Controls what data is fetched on load. These follow the same format as the JS SDK parameters.

layout_options.description: Options of the views. The properties in here are controlled by the layout.

patch.description: Update multiple presets at the same time.

collection.description: What collection this collection preset is used for.

title.description: Name for the bookmark. If this is set, the collection preset will be considered to be a bookmark.

role.description: The unique identifier of a role in the platform. If user is null, this will be used to apply the collection preset or bookmark for all users in the role.

search.description: What the user searched for in search/filter in the header bar.

layout.description: Name of the view type that is used.

layout_query.description: Layout query that's saved per layout type. Controls what data is fetched on load. These follow the same format as the JS SDK parameters.

layout_options.description: Options of the views. The properties in here are controlled by the layout.

get.description: Retrieve a single preset by unique identifier.

collection.description: What collection this collection preset is used for.

title.description: Name for the bookmark. If this is set, the collection preset will be considered to be a bookmark.

role.description: The unique identifier of a role in the platform. If user is null, this will be used to apply the collection preset or bookmark for all users in the role.

search_query.description: What the user searched for in search/filter in the header bar.

view_type.description: Name of the view type that is used. Defaults to tabular.

view_query.description: View query that's saved per view type. Controls what data is fetched on load. These follow the same format as the JS SDK parameters.

view_options.description: Options of the views. The properties in here are controlled by the layout.

translation.description: Key value pair of language-translation. Can be used to translate the bookmark title in multiple languages.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description: Image typed files can be dynamically resized and transformed to fit any need.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: All data within the platform is private by default. The public role can be configured to expose data without authentication, or you can pass an access token to the API to access private data.

tags.name: Schema
tags.description: Retrieve and update the schema of an instance.

tags.name: Server
tags.description: Access to where Directus runs. Allows you to make sure your server has everything needed to run the platform, and check what kind of latency we're dealing with.

tags.name: Utilities
tags.description: Directus comes with various utility endpoints you can use to simplify your development flow.

tags.name: Activity
tags.description: All events that happen within Directus are tracked and stored in the activities collection. This gives you full accountability over everything that happens.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: Files can be saved in any given location. Directus has a powerful assets endpoint that can be used to generate thumbnails for images on the fly.

tags.name: Collections
tags.description: Collections are the individual collections of items, similar to tables in a database. Changes to collections will alter the schema of the database.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: Roles are groups of users that share permissions.

tags.name: Fields
tags.description: Fields are individual pieces of content within an item. They are mapped to columns in the database.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Users are what gives you access to the data.

tags.name: Revisions
tags.description: Revisions are individual changes to items made. Directus keeps track of changes made, so you're able to revert to a previous state at will.

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description: Permissions control who has access to what and when.

tags.name: Relations
tags.description: What data is linked to what other data. Allows you to assign authors to articles, products to sales, and whatever other structures you can think of.

tags.name: Presets
tags.description: Presets hold the preferences of individual users of the platform. This allows Directus to show and maintain custom item listings for users of the app.

tags.name: Flows
tags.description: Flows enable custom, event-driven data processing and task automation.

tags.name: Operations
tags.description: Operations are the building blocks within Data Flows.

tags.name: Extensions
tags.description: Directus can easily be extended through the addition of several types of extensions, including layouts, interfaces, and modules.

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: Settings control the way the platform works and acts.

tags.name: Comments
tags.description: Comments can be added to items.

tags.name: Versions
tags.description: Enables users to create unpublished copies of an item, modify them independently from the main version, and promote them to become the new main version when ready.

tags.name: Items Taxonomies
tags.description: Unified taxonomy system for all content types

tags.name: Items Glossary Tags
tags.description: Glossary term tag relationships with semantic tracking

tags.name: Items Block Feature Card
tags.description: Individual feature card blocks used in feature sections

tags.name: Items Pages
tags.description: Each page item in this collection represents a complete web page

tags.name: Items Section Text
tags.description: A text content section module for paragraphs and rich content

tags.name: Items Section Features
tags.description: A feature cards section for highlighting product or service features

tags.name: Items Core Blocks
tags.description: Universal reusable content blocks that can be used in multiple section types

tags.name: Items Scheduled Events
tags.description: All scheduled events including webinars and workshops (free and paid)

tags.name: Items Block FAQ Item
tags.description: Individual FAQ items with Schema.org structured data for SEO

tags.name: Items Section FAQ
tags.description: SEO-optimized FAQ accordion section with Schema.org markup support

storage.description: Where the file is stored. Either `local` for the local filesystem or the name of the storage adapter (for example `s3`).

filename_disk.description: Name of the file on disk. By default, Directus uses a random hash for the filename.

filename_download.description: How you want to the file to be named when it's being downloaded.

title.description: Title for the file. Is extracted from the filename on upload, but can be edited by the user.

folder.description: Virtual folder where this file resides in.

filesize.description: Size of the file in bytes.

width.description: Width of the file in pixels. Only applies to images.

height.description: Height of the file in pixels. Only applies to images.

duration.description: Duration of the file in seconds. Only applies to audio and video.

embed.description: Where the file was embedded from.

location.description: Where the file was created. Is automatically populated based on Exif data for images.

tags.description: Tags for the file. Is automatically populated based on Exif data for images.

metadata.description: IPTC, Exif, and ICC metadata extracted from file

uploaded_on.description: When the file was last uploaded/replaced.

parent.description: Unique identifier of the parent folder. This allows for nested folders.

description.example: Admins have access to all managed data within the system by default

email.description: Unique email address for the user.

language.description: The user's language used in Directus.

tfa_secret.description: The 2FA secret string that's used to generate one time passwords.

role.description: Unique identifier of the role of this user.

last_access.description: When this user used the API last.

last_page.description: Last page that the user was on.

fields.description: Control what fields are being returned in the object.

search.description: Filter by items that contain the given search query in one of their fields.

sort.description: How to sort the returned items.

limit.description: Set the maximum number of items that will be returned

offset.description: How many items to skip when fetching data.

page.description: Cursor for use in pagination. Often used in combination with limit.

deep.description: Deep allows you to set any of the other query parameters on a nested relational dataset.

total_count.description: Returns the total item count of the collection you're querying.

filter_count.description: Returns the item count of the collection you're querying, taking the current filter/search parameters into account.

user.description: The user who performed this action.

ip.description: The IP address of the user at the time the action took place.

user_agent.description: User agent string of the browser the user used when the action took place.
user_agent.example: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_15_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML,like Gecko) Chrome/78.0.3904.108 Safari/537.36

collection.description: Collection identifier in which the item resides.

item.description: Unique identifier for the item the action applied to. This is always a string, even for integer primary keys.

origin.description: Origin of the request when the action took place.

collection.description: The collection key.
Unique name of the collection this field is in.

field.description: Unique name of the field. Field name is unique within the collection.

activity.description: Unique identifier for the activity record.

collection.description: Collection of the updated item.

data.description: Copy of item state at time of update.

delta.description: Changes between the previous and the current revision.

parent.description: If the current item was updated relationally, this is the id of the parent revision record

collection.description: What collection this permission applies to.

action.description: What action this permission applies to.

permissions.description: JSON structure containing the permissions checks for this permission.

validation.description: JSON structure containing the validation checks for this permission.

presets.description: JSON structure containing the preset value for created/updated items.

fields.description: CSV of fields that the user is allowed to interact with.

many_collection.description: Collection that has the field that holds the foreign key.

many_field.description: Foreign key. Field that holds the primary key of the related collection.

one_collection.description: Collection on the _one_ side of the relationship.

one_field.description: Alias column that serves as the _one_ side of the relationship.

junction_field.description: Field on the junction table that holds the many field of the related relation.

id.description: Unique identifier for this single collection preset.

bookmark.description: Name for the bookmark. If this is set, the preset will be considered a bookmark.

user.description: The unique identifier of the user to whom this collection preset applies.

role.description: The unique identifier of a role in the platform. If `user` is null, this will be used to apply the collection preset or bookmark for all users in the role.

collection.description: What collection this collection preset is used for.

layout.description: Key of the layout that is used.

layout_query.description: Layout query that's saved per layout type. Controls what data is fetched on load. These follow the same format as the JS SDK parameters.

layout_options.description: Options of the views. The properties in here are controlled by the layout.

data.description: If yes, send the content of what was done

actions.description: The actions that triggers this webhook.

icon.description: Icon displayed in the Admin App for the flow.

color.description: Color of the icon displayed in the Admin App for the flow.

trigger.description: Type of trigger for the flow. One of `hook`, `webhook`, `operation`, `schedule`, `manual`.

accountability.description: The permission used during the flow. One of `$public`, `$trigger`, `$full`, or UUID of a role.

options.description: Options of the selected trigger for the flow.

operation.description: UUID of the operation connected to the trigger in the flow.

date_created.description: Timestamp in ISO8601 when the flow was created.

user_created.description: The user who created the flow.

key.description: Key for the operation. Must be unique within a given flow.

type.description: Type of operation. One of `log`, `mail`, `notification`, `create`, `read`, `request`, `sleep`, `transform`, `trigger`, `condition`, or any type of custom operation extensions.

position_x.description: Position of the operation on the X axis within the flow workspace.

position_y.description: Position of the operation on the Y axis within the flow workspace.

options.description: Options depending on the type of the operation.

resolve.description: The operation triggered when the current operation succeeds (or `then` logic of a condition operation).

reject.description: The operation triggered when the current operation fails (or `otherwise` logic of a condition operation).

date_created.description: Timestamp in ISO8601 when the operation was created.

user_created.description: The user who created the operation.

bundle.description: Name of the bundle the extension is in.

project_color.description: The brand color of the project.

public_note.description: Note rendered on the public pages of the app.

auth_login_attempts.description: Allowed authentication login attempts before the user's status is set to blocked.

storage_asset_transform.description: What transformations are allowed in the assets endpoint.

key.description: Key for the asset. Used in the assets endpoint.

fit.description: Whether to crop the thumbnail to match the size, or maintain the aspect ratio.

arguments.description: A list of arguments to pass to the Sharp method

argument.description: A JSON representation of the argument value

id.description: Unique identifier for this single collection preset.

collection.description: The collection of the item the Comment is created for.

item.description: The item the Comment is created for.

comment.description: User comment. This will store the comments that show up in the right sidebar of the item edit page in the admin app.

id.description: Primary key of the Content Version.

key.description: Key of the Content Version, used as the value for the "version" query parameter.

name.description: Descriptive name of the Content Version.

collection.description: Name of the collection the Content Version is created on.

item.description: The item the Content Version is created on.

date_created.description: When the Content Version was created.

date_updated.description: When the Content Version was last updated.

user_created.description: User that created the Content Version.

user_updated.description: User that last updated the Content Version.

delta.description: The current changes compared to the main version of the item.

primary.description: Designates the primary category for the blog post

slug.description: URL-friendly version of the title. Automatically generated from name.

description.description: Clarify when this is used in case it's not self-explanatory

filter_priority.description: Controls the order in which this term appears in filter interfaces

child_count.description: Number of child taxonomies, updated via hooks

content_count.description: Number of associated content items, updated via hooks

last_content_date.description: Most recent content association date, updated via hooks

context.description: Used to control field visibility based on creation context

canonical_url.description: Canonical URL if content exists elsewhere

og_title.description: Open Graph title for social sharing

og_description.description: Open Graph description for social sharing

og_image_id.description: Open Graph image for social sharing

slug.description: URL-friendly version of the title. Automatically generated from title.

published.description: This date gets populated only when the page gets PUBLISHED. Any other status has no effect on it.

last_modified.description: This date gets populated only when the page status is set to published AFTER the content is edited. It will remain unset until the page is published a second time.

access_tier.description: Access tier controls user ability to register for or participate in scheduled events

seo_metadata_id.description: SEO metadata for this service package
SEO metadata for this subscription plan
SEO metadata for this time package

card_color.description: Optional background color for this card

description.description: Describe the purpose of the content block. Provide examples if it's not self-explanatory.

access_tier.description: Access tier controls user ability to register for or participate in scheduled events

date_last_modified.description: This date gets populated only when the page status is set to published AFTER the content is edited. It will remain unset until the page is published a second time.

responsive_columns.description: Number of columns at different screen sizes (mobile:tablet:desktop)

block_type.description: The type of block determines which fields are available

applies_to.description: Select which section types this block can be used in

title.description: Title or heading for the block

settings.description: Additional configuration options for this block

title_embedding.description: Vector embedding for title field (automatically generated)

scheduled_announce_date.description: Add a scheduled date if the event should only be announced on or after a given date and/or time. You can set the event to published and it will only appear in notifications and on relevant pages at that time.

description.description: Describe the event! Tell the people what they want to know!

access_tier.description: Access tier controls user ability to register for or participate in scheduled events

is_expanded.description: Override section default to always show this specific item

keyword_tags.description: Keywords for semantic search (helps with frontend filtering)

title.description: Main title for the FAQ section (appears in Schema.org markup)

subtitle.description: Optional explanatory text for the FAQ section

accordion_behavior.description: Determines if multiple FAQ items can be expanded simultaneously

default_open.description: Whether to expand the first FAQ item when the page loads

enable_schema_markup.description: Generate Schema.org markup for enhanced search engine visibility

search_enabled.description: Allow users to search within FAQ items

Collection.description: Collection of which you want to retrieve the items from.
Collection.name: collection

Search.description: Filter by items that contain the given search query in one of their fields.
Search.name: search

Page.description: Cursor for use in pagination. Often used in combination with limit.
Page.name: page

Offset.description: How many items to skip when fetching data.
Offset.name: offset

Sort.description: How to sort the returned items. `sort` is a CSV of fields used to sort the fetched items. Sorting defaults to ascending (ASC) order but a minus sign (` - `) can be used to reverse this to descending (DESC) order. Fields are prioritized by their order in the CSV. You can also use a ` ? ` to sort randomly.
Sort.name: sort

Meta.description: What metadata to return in the response.
Meta.name: meta

Limit.description: A limit on the number of objects that are returned.
Limit.name: limit

Filter.description: Select items in collection by given conditions.
Filter.name: filter

Fields.description: Control what fields are being returned in the object.
Fields.name: fields

Export.name: export
Export.description: Saves the API response to a file. Accepts one of "csv", "json", "xml", "yaml".

Version.name: version
Version.description: Retrieve an item's state from a specific Content Version. The value corresponds to the "key" of the Content Version.
